citation.case_name: South Carolina Bd. of Ed. v. Brown

html:
393 U.S. 222

89 S.Ct. 449

21 L.Ed.2d 391

SOUTH CAROLINA STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION et al.
v.
J. Arthur BROWN et al.

No. 553.

Mrs. Ernest T. CRIBB et al.

v.

J. Arthur BROWN et al.

No. 563.

Supreme Court of the United States

December 9, 1968

Daniel R. McLeod, Atty. Gen. of § uth Carolina, and D. W. Robinson, for appellants South Carolina State Board of Education and others.

J. C. Long, for appellants Mrs. Ernest T. Cribb and others.

Solicitor General Griswold and Assistant Attorney General Pollak, for appellee United States.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to affirm is granted and the judgment is affirmed.
html_lawbox:
393 U.S. 222 (1968)

SOUTH CAROLINA STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION ET AL.
v.
BROWN ET AL.

No. 553.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided December 9, 1968.[*]
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF SOUTH CAROLINA.

Daniel R. McLeod, Attorney General of South Carolina, and D. W. Robinson for appellants in No. 553. J. C. Long for appellants in No. 563.

Solicitor General Griswold and Assistant Attorney General Pollak for appellee United States in both cases.

PER CURIAM.

The motion to affirm is granted and the judgment is affirmed.

NOTES

[*] Together with No. 563, Cribb et al. v. Brown et al., also on appeal from the same court.
